title: Free cinema tickets for Ken Loach's new film
text:

We’ve teamed up with Entertainment One to bring you the chance to watch the powerful film Sorry We Missed You, the latest creation from the team that brought you I, Daniel Blake. And the best bit is, you could watch it completely free.

Directed by Ken Loach, Sorry We Missed You speaks from the heart of modern day Britain. From those living on the brink of zero-hour contracts, tireless service economies and family strains.

These contemporary issues will be brought to life on the silver screen on November 1 – and it's a film we feel everyone should see. So we’re giving you the opportunity to attend a special screening next Tuesday, October 15.

You’ll get to view it before it hits the cinemas by claiming a free ticket to one of our screenings. Just remember to act fast, as tickets are on a first-come, first-served basis.

WHAT'S IT ABOUT?

The story follows Ricky and his family enduring an uphill battle following the 2008 financial crash.

As a delivery worker, Ricky is driven to the edge suffering long hours and minimal benefits, just like his wife, Abbie, a contract nurse.

Both workloads place immense strain on their family life and the film shares a heartwarming look at human sacrifice in times of economic and political upheaval.

HOW TO CLAIM YOUR TICKETS

To receive a pair of tickets, log onto seeitfirst.com and simply follow the instructions.

You'll also be able to find your nearest screening on the website.

Provided there are seats available at your chosen cinema, you’ll be able to print off a pair of tickets to take along on the night. But remember – it’s first come, first served, so act now to avoid missing out.

Terms and Conditions: (1) Tickets are subject to availability and will be allocated on a first-come, first-served basis via the Booking Website. (2) Users who successfully claim tickets will need to print off the email with a valid booking number and take it along to the cinema on the day of the film preview at the time given. (3) Possession of a ticket does not guarantee entry. In the event of an insufficiency of seats due to our standard overbooking policy to account for no-shows or a change in size of cinema screen, entry will be granted to ticket holders on a first-come first-served basis. Ticket holders will not be able to hold spaces for guests and entry will only be granted to customers once all guests have arrived. (4) Unless otherwise stated, a maximum of two tickets are redeemable per user. Should a user exceed this maximum, See Film First Ltd reserves the right to revoke tickets without notice. (5) No cash alternative. (6) No late admittance. (7) The cinemas reserve the right to refuse admission. In the event of a dispute, the cinema manager’s decision is final. (8) In the event of a film preview being cancelled, changed or relocated without prior notice, See Film First Ltd may at its own discretion allocate tickets to the next See Film First Ltd film preview in the nearest cinema. No form of compensation, financial or otherwise will be given. (9) Should a film preview be overbooked, See Film First Ltd may at its own discretion allocate tickets to the next See Film First Ltd film preview in the nearest cinema. No form of compensation, financial or otherwise will be given. (10) Sound and video recording/photography equipment is not permitted in the auditorium and in some instances may be confiscated upon entry. For full terms and conditions visit, www.bit.ly./filmbookingterms
